text: hi everyone is Ellen here today I'm
going to make a super eye-catching
nutritious and delicious dish to serve
with rice is called cotugno tip or
stuffed tomatoes as you know tomatoes
are rich in vitamin A and it's really
good for your skin and this is a great
dish to serve in a daily family meal in
Vietnam so let's begin
Fuzzy's soccer buffeting grams of
shiitake mushrooms in hot water for
about 15 minutes to soften then squeeze
out the excess water cut into strips and
then file a Ming's these mushrooms are
called Nam whom they are smaller than
shitake mushrooms and a lot more
fragrant feel free to use other kinds of
mushrooms that you like for the fillings
you also need hundred fifty gram of
mince meat you can hear chicken pork or
turkey season with some chicken stock
salt and pepper about half a teaspoon
each then combined with the mince
mushrooms a teaspoon of minced shallots
or the white part of spring onion mix
well and set aside for about 15 minutes
for this recipe you will need phyto
Meadows which weights around 450 gram or
1 pound cut off the top part about a
quarter of the tomatoes nearer to the
stem then you are spoon to scoop out the
inside and gather into a bowl
cut off a little bit at the bottom so
the tomato cup can stand stable then
finally dice up the top pot for the
inside pots you can remove the seeds so
it not too sour and also finally dies
next dice up half a small onion place
all the tomato cups on a plate and
sprinkle some tapioca starch or over the
base this will have the fillings to
stick better to the cup and it will not
fall off when we cook then stop the meat
and mushrooms fillings into each tomato
Cup the meat gonna expand as we cook so
you don't need to stuff too tight next
is the vegetable oil in a frying pan and
place the tomato cuts into it
facing the meat side down then cover and
cook on low heat for about five to seven
minutes
then flip them over cover and cook for
another five to seven minutes remove the
stop tomatoes and transfer to a plate
pour out the frying oil and just keep a
little bit left in the pan add the diced
onion and stir fry until it turn
translucent then add the chopped
tomatoes and season with a teaspoon of
sugar and a tablespoons of fish sauce
stir fry for about five minutes on low
heat until the tomatoes break up and
turn into a sauce you can add a little
bit of water if the tomatoes are not
producing enough liquid finally add some
chopped green onions and
and off the heat pour the sauce over the
stop tomatoes and sprinkle with some
more chopped green onions or cilantro on
top a little bit of cracked pepper or
chilies if you want more heat and it's
done oh it smells so good and it looks
amazing
if you liked the video don't forget to
give it a good thumbs up and subscribe
to my channel for more delicious
Vietnamese food if you're going to give
it a try don't forget to share a photo
of your foods on instagram with hashtag
heron recipes so I can see how great
your food turns out thank you for
watching bye
